document_title: Water and Waste Disposal Technical Assistance and Training Grants
program_description_intro: This program provides funding to nonprofit organizations who in turn provide technical assistance and training to:
program_objective_1: Identify and evaluate solutions to water and waste problems
program_objective_2: Help applicants prepare applications for water and waste disposal loans and grants
program_objective_3: Help associations improve the operation and maintenance of water and waste facilities in eligible rural areas.
who_can_apply: Nonprofits with the ability, background, experience, and capacity to provide technical assistance or training on a national, regional, or state basis.
eligible_area_criteria: Rural areas and towns with 10,000 or fewer residents, including tribal lands and colonias in rural areas.
grant_term_project_period: The project period for these grants is one year starting Oct. 1 and ending Sept. 30.
grant_term_applicant_contributions: Applicant contributions must be used before USDA grant funds.
grant_term_funding_availability: Grants are subject to the availability of funds.
how_to_get_started_help_source: Your local USDA Rural Development office can help.
questions_contact_method: The grant manager for this program may be contacted at
governing_program_code_2_name: Section 306306(a)(14) of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act 7 U.S.C. 1921
note_information_changes_warning: Because information changes, always consult official program instructions or contact your local USDA Rural Development office for help.
note_equal_opportunity_statement: USDA is an equal opportunity provider, employer, and lender.
